channel.title: Error who can fix it? have screenshot
channel.description:
in compiler stands client.java:7658: 'try' whitout 'catch' or 'finaly' try < ^
and i think i found the problem too but wat i need to change? [IMG]http://i653.photobucket.com/albums/uu256/jaspertjeoo/error-1.jpg[/img]

item.title: Error who can fix it? have screenshot
item.dc:creator: @AfterLifeLochie AfterLifeLochie
item.description:
@AfterLifeLochie wrote:

[quote=“spy man47, post:12, topic:331916”]Try this :

if(command.startsWith("kill")) { try { String name = command.substring(5); int p = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name); client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[p]; p.sM("You have been killed by "+playerName+"."); p.youdied(); } }[/quote]

You MUST ALWAYS have a catch when you use try. You need a try in this block because you are trying to refrence another instance of the application, thus failing would cause a general exception.

Read full topic
item.source: Error who can fix it? have screenshot

item.title: Error who can fix it? have screenshot
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

You don’t need a try block with that type of code…

You need to have an [code=Java]
if(c != null) {

}
[/code]

Because the catch will not be thrown anywhere in that code.

Read full topic

item.title: Error who can fix it? have screenshot
item.dc:creator: @AfterLifeLochie AfterLifeLochie
item.description:
@AfterLifeLochie wrote:

[code=java]if(command.startsWith(“killall”)) {
for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players) {
client castOn = (client) p;
castOn.youdied();
}
}

if(command.startsWith(“kill”)) {
String name = command.substring(5);
try {
int p = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name);
client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[p];
c.sM(“You have been killed by “+playerName+”.”);
c.youdied();
} catch (Exception e) {}
}[/code]

Edit: Thanks madgamer for the pickup, I refrenced the player’s ID and not the actual player’s playerHandler instance.

Read full topic

item.title: Error who can fix it? have screenshot
item.dc:creator: @madgamer madgamer
item.description:
@madgamer wrote:

If you don’t have a catch on your try statement then you are going to get that error.

[code]
try {

/* code here */

} catch (Exception _e) {}[/code]

Read full topic
